## On planning and structuring

It is good to start with pen and paper to plan the structure of an essay or talk, and take notes

*	Mueller and Oppenheimer (2014) [The Pen is Mightier Than the Keyboard: Advantages of Longhand Over Laptop Note Taking](https://journals-sagepub-com.manchester.idm.oclc.org/doi/abs/10.1177/0956797614524581) Psychological Science  
*	Chatfield (2015) [Why reading and writing on paper can be better for your brain](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/feb/23/reading-writing-on-paper-better-for-brain-concentration), The Guardian  
*	James and Engelhardt (2012) [The effects of handwriting experience on functional brain development in pre-literate children](https://ac-els-cdn-com.manchester.idm.oclc.org/S2211949312000038/1-s2.0-S2211949312000038-main.pdf?_tid=51b09555-c005-4d58-8a11-2e3882d207c5&acdnat=1549801482_911df8fdf04ed64451f15c98ff895b67), Trends in Neuroscience and Education; 


## On Fact Checking

It is the author's duty to ensure that any facts presented, to the best of the author's knowledge, are correct. This site by the [Economics Network](https://www.economicsnetwork.ac.uk/internet/fact-checking) links to a number of fact checking exercises by news organisations and to resources useful for students having to evaluate the veracity of facts.
